title: Terror attack foiled in US: FBI chief offers details; arrests made in Michigan
content: The FBI successfully thwarted a potential terrorist attack planned for Michigan's Halloween weekend, arresting multiple subjects allegedly involved in the plot. Director Kash Patel credited law enforcement for their vigilance in defending the homeland. Authorities assure the public there is no ongoing threat to the community.

title: Tanzania crisis: Over 700 protesters dead, says oppn; what triggered unrest?
content: Tanzania's opposition party, Chadema, claims around 700 people have died in election protests, alleging widespread fraud. The government has imposed an internet blackout and curfew amid violent clashes between demonstrators and security forces. The UN has urged restraint and condemned the use of force.

title: Haryana men captured in Iran: 'Donkers' want ransom, claim kin; seek govt's help
content: Two young men from Haryana's Karnal district, promised jobs in Spain, are now held captive in Iran. Traffickers are reportedly torturing them and threatening to sell their kidneys if a ransom isn't paid. Their families have filed a police complaint and are appealing to the government for their safe return.

title: '100% Pak agent': Himanta targets Congress' Gaurav Gogoi again
content: Assam chief minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has leveled serious accusations against Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi, labeling him a "100 per cent Pakistani agent" planted by foreign powers. Sarma reiterated past claims of a conspiracy to undermine India's sovereignty, citing alleged links and Gogoi's response to the Bangladesh anthem row as evidence of tacit approval.

title: India sets 3 world records: Swasth Nari campaign gets global recognition
content: India has achieved three Guinness World Records for its nationwide women's health campaign, Swasth Nari, Sashakt Parivar Abhiyaan. The initiative saw millions register for healthcare platforms, breast cancer, and vital signs screenings. Reaching every district, the campaign involved extensive community participation and health camps, underscoring a significant stride in preventive and women-centric healthcare.

title: Fried chicken frenzy: Nvidia CEO's dinner sparks stock rally; Huang effect
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's dinner with South Korean tech leaders sparked a significant rally in the nation's food sector, with shares of Kyochon F&B and poultry processor Cherrybro surging. The meeting, which included a symbolic gift of AI systems, underscored deepening commercial ties and demonstrated Huang's immense market influence beyond the tech industry.

title: India-US trade deal: Piyush Goyal says in 'advanced stages' of talks; what to expect
content: India and the US are in advanced trade deal talks, with Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal hinting at an imminent agreement. This follows US President Trump's positive remarks. The proposed deal could significantly slash US tariffs on Indian exports, potentially from 50% to 15%.

title: Bengal SIR: TMC warns of legal action, protests; calls it 'Silent Invisible Rigging'
content: The Trinamool Congress has warned of legal action and protests against alleged irregularities in West Bengal's voter list revision, accusing the BJP of attempting to rig upcoming elections. Party leader Abhishek Banerjee stated that if any eligible voter's name is removed, a massive demonstration will be held outside the Election Commission office. Help desks will be established to assist voters.

title: Instagram post row: Top exec's video forces SEC filing for storage giant; details here
content: Snowflake's Chief Revenue Officer inadvertently shared unauthorized financial projections on Instagram, prompting an SEC filing. The company cautioned investors against relying on these figures, which differed from its official guidance.  Despite the executive's misstep, Snowflake's shares have seen significant growth this year.

title: 'Oh, is he?': Abhishek Sharma’s hilarious reaction to reporter's question - Watch
content: Australia's pace spearhead Josh Hazlewood will miss the remainder of the T20I series against India to focus on domestic cricket and prepare for the Ashes. Hazlewood's absence is a relief for Indian batters after his match-winning spell in the second T20I. Abhishek Sharma, despite facing Hazlewood's precision, enjoyed the challenge of batting against a world-class bowler.

title: An Indian student’s journey in Canada: Facing competition; making smart moves
content: Pallavi Thapar's life-changing decision to study at the University of Waterloo, driven by its co-op program, provided invaluable real-world experience and professional networking opportunities in Canada. Her journey from psychology to marketing, coupled with embracing independence and Canadian culture, highlights the transformative power of adaptability and ambition abroad.

title: Jan Suraaj worker killed in Bihar: EC seeks report; tension grips region
content: Tension grips Mokama after a Jan Suraaj Party supporter's murder during election campaigning. EC has requested detailed report from the DGP. Stones were pelted at an RJD candidate's car following the incident. Jan Suraaj founder Prashant Kishor condemned the violence, calling it a failure of law and order and a reflection of 'jungle raj' in Bihar. Police are investigating the firing incident.

title: Amazon cuts 14,000 jobs: CEO Andy Jassy breaks silence; what he said
content: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy revealed that the recent layoff of 14,000 employees isn't due to financial woes or AI, but rather a cultural shift. He explained that rapid growth led to increased layers and diluted ownership, slowing down operations. This contrasts with other executive statements emphasizing AI's transformative role and the need for leaner structures.

title: $5 trillion valuation: Why Nvidia is not bigger than the Indian economy
content: Nvidia's $5 trillion market capitalization surpasses India's GDP, but this comparison is flawed. Market cap reflects investor expectations of future profits, while GDP measures annual economic output. Accurately comparing the two, revenue shows Nvidia's ~$130.5B fiscal-year 2025 revenue is just over 3% of India's ~$4.1–$4.2T economy.

title: No impact of US curbs? Russian oil continues to flow; Indian Oil buys more crude
content: Despite US pressure, Indian Oil Corporation has ordered five Russian crude oil shipments for December delivery from non-sanctioned entities. While some Indian refiners have suspended purchases due to sanctions, IOC plans to continue procuring Russian crude as long as it complies with regulations.

title: 'He fired, we retaliated': How Mumbai hostage drama turned fatal; cops share details
content: Social entrepreneur Rohit Aarrya, known for his work on Swachh Bharat and awareness videos, took 19 children hostage in Chembur. He claimed to have simple, moral demands and sought a conversation with unnamed individuals, threatening to harm the children if provoked. Aarrya stated his actions were part of a plan to conduct a 'Let's Change' program.

title: Rana's 104m monster hit leaves Gambhir stunned; reaction caught on camera - WATCH
content: Abhishek Sharma's valiant 68 and Harshit Rana's steady 35 were the lone bright spots as India faltered to 125 against Australia. Despite their efforts, Australia chased down the target comfortably, with Mitchell Marsh's 46 leading the charge. Josh Hazlewood's exceptional bowling crippled India's top order, securing a four-wicket win and a 1-0 series lead.

title: 'Boots on the ground': Ayesha Curry reacts as Hurricane Melissa devastates Jamaica
content: Ayesha Curry has shown support for those affected by Hurricane Melissa in Jamaica. She shared posts from World Central Kitchen and the NBA highlighting relief efforts. Curry praised the 'boots on the ground' teams ensuring people are fed. Her actions demonstrate her commitment to philanthropy, as seen through her Eat. Learn. Play Foundation.

title: 'Sorry patra': Tejashwi, Cong tear into NDA's Bihar manifesto; mock press event
content: Bihar's ruling NDA alliance launched its election manifesto, "Sankalp Patra," promising jobs and development. The opposition Mahagathbandhan, led by Tejashwi Yadav, dismissed it as "jumla," demanding an apology for the state's alleged failures over 20 years of NDA rule. Congress echoed the criticism, questioning the manifesto's timing and the chief minister's limited role.

title: IND vs AUS: India batters poor; Australia take 1-0 lead
content: Australia secured a comfortable four-wicket victory over India in the second T20I at the MCG, taking a 1-0 series lead. India's batting faltered, managing only 125 despite Abhishek Sharma's 68, with Josh Hazlewood taking 3 wickets. Australia chased down the target in 13.2 overs, led by Mitchell Marsh's 46. The 3rd T20I will be played on Sunday, November 2.

title: Study in the UK: Autumn timelines decoded; why Indian students must start early
content: The United Kingdom continues to be a preferred destination for Indian students, especially for the Autumn Intake that starts each September or October. However, most applicants underestimate how early they must begin. By March, competitive courses begin reviewing applications, and by April, most scholarships close. Starting early—shortlisting, preparing statements, gathering references, and completing visa formalities—helps avoid the last-minute rush that often derails otherwise strong profiles.

title: Rs 2cr dues, moral demands: What triggered Rohit Aarrya’s hostage act in Mumbai - timeline of events
content: A social entrepreneur, Rohit Aarrya, held 17 children and others hostage in a Mumbai studio after feeling betrayed by the government over his civic initiative. The standoff ended in a police shootout, with Aarrya dead and the hostages rescued. His actions stemmed from a perceived lack of accountability and stolen ideas.

title: How to view 3I/ATLAS in the US
content: Discovered in early July 2025 by the Asteroid Terrestrial-impact Last Alert System (ATLAS) in Hawaii, 3I/ATLAS is moving on a hyperbolic path — meaning it’s not gravitationally bound to our Sun. It entered the solar system from deep interstellar space and will leave just as swiftly, never to return.

title: One crore govt jobs & more: NDA releases manifesto for Bihar polls; key promises
content: The NDA on Friday unveiled its Bihar election manifesto, promising one crore jobs, industrial growth, and major infrastructure projects. Released in Patna by CM Nitish Kumar and BJP leaders, it focuses on youth skills, women’s empowerment, and rural upliftment. The rival Mahagathbandhan pledges one job per family, OPS restoration, women’s aid, and 200 free electricity units.

title: Tua Tagovailoa reacts as Dolphins hit rock bottom after Ravens loss
content: Miami Dolphins' season teeters on the brink after a dismal 28-6 loss to the Ravens. A players-only meeting followed, with quarterback Tua Tagovailoa admitting to "heartfelt conversations" about the team's mounting mistakes and turnovers. This defeat amplifies existing concerns about leadership and systemic issues, leaving fans questioning the team's ability to recover.

title: Jury orders NCAA to pay $18mn to ex-SC State star Robert Geathers and his wife
content: A South Carolina jury awarded $18 million to former South Carolina State player Robert Geathers and his wife, finding the NCAA negligent for failing to warn players about the long-term risks of concussions. Geathers, diagnosed with dementia and showing symptoms of CTE, played from 1977-1980. Attorneys argued the NCAA withheld crucial information about concussion dangers.

title: 'Extrajudicial killings': UN condemns US strikes on drug boats; calls for immediate halt
content: The UN has strongly condemned US strikes on vessels in the Caribbean and Pacific, allegedly carrying drug traffickers, calling them "extrajudicial killings." UN rights chief Volker Turk urged the US to halt these attacks, stating they violate international human rights law and have resulted in over 60 deaths since September. The UN is calling for an investigation into these incidents.

title: IND vs AUS: Surya loses toss again; has hilarious reaction - watch video
content: India captain Suryakumar Yadav humorously reacted to losing another toss against Australia, suggesting an 'Aarti' to change their luck.  Despite the lighthearted moment, India's batters struggled, collapsing to 32/4 early on. Abhishek Sharma's 68 offered resistance, but India was bowled out for 125. The first T20I ended without a result due to rain.

title: 'A film about hostage situation': Actor reveals how she was approached by Rohit Aarrya
content: Marathi actress Ruchita Jadhav narrowly escaped a hostage situation after cancelling a meeting with Rohit Aarrya, the man who later held children and others captive. Aarrya, a self-styled filmmaker, was shot dead by police after a three-hour standoff. He had previously sought payment for a school cleanliness project.

title: INDW vs AUSW: 'Jemimah's century better than my '83 semi-final fifty', says Patil
content: India's women's cricket team secured a historic five-wicket win against Australia in the 2025 World Cup semi-final. This monumental victory has drawn parallels to the 1983 men's World Cup triumph, with legends like Sunil Gavaskar and Sandeep Patil lauding the performance.

title: TS Inter time table 2026: 1st and 2nd year exam dates out; full schedule here
content: The Telangana State Board of Intermediate Education has released the IPE 2026 timetable for first and second-year students. Exams commence in late February and conclude in mid-March, with practical exams scheduled from February 2 to February 21. Hall tickets will be available approximately two weeks prior to the examinations.

title: Nasty! Shubman Gill hit on the head; falls for just five runs vs AUS
content: India's top order collapsed spectacularly in the second T20I against Australia, losing early wickets within the powerplay. Josh Hazlewood's fiery opening spell, including a blow to Shubman Gill's helmet, unsettled the batters. India found themselves in deep trouble at 92/5 after 13 overs, with their top order crumbling under pressure.

title: SpaceX reveals simplified Starship plan to speed up Artemis 3 moon mission
content: SpaceX has submitted a simplified Starship mission plan to NASA, aiming for a faster and safer lunar landing. This comes amid NASA's concerns about the rocket's readiness for Artemis III, with the agency reportedly facing internal pressures. SpaceX highlighted its development milestones and upcoming tests, including crucial in-space refuelling demonstrations.

title: IND vs AUS: A perfect reply to trolls? Harshit justifies Gambhir’s call
content: Team India all-rounder Harshit Rana impressed with a fighting 35 against Australia.  The Delhi pacer showed resilience with the bat after India's top order collapsed.  His innings validated Gautam Gambhir's faith in domestic talent.  Rana's performance highlighted the need for multi-dimensional cricketers in modern cricket.  He displayed courage and belief under pressure.

title: Rampage Jackson’s $1mn plea after UFC 321 hints at a shift in Dana White’s era
content: Former UFC champion Quinton “Rampage” Jackson urges the promotion to significantly increase fight bonuses to $1 million, arguing it will incentivize more exciting, knockout-focused fights. This call follows UFC 321's criticism for excessive ground control and a controversial no-contest, with Jackson believing higher rewards will foster 'real fights' and better entertainment for fans.

title: India win Women's World Cup? INDW beat SA by 100 runs, claims internet's 'encyclopedia'
content: Wikipedia users discovered a premature posting of the ICC Women's World Cup 2025 final result, showing India defeating South Africa by 100 runs, despite the match being scheduled for Sunday. The fabricated scores contained mathematical errors, highlighting Wikipedia's open editing policy. Editors are expected to rectify such unauthorised modifications promptly.

title: ‘Break-up’ leave for Gen Z: Should bosses care? Boundaries and coping tips
content: A Gurugram startup employee’s candid email requesting “break-up leave” has sparked a nationwide debate on emotional transparency at work. As Gen Z blurs the line between personal and professional boundaries, experts are questioning whether workplaces should institutionalise such leaves. The viral incident underscores a generational shift prioritising mental well-being, empathy, and emotional authenticity over traditional notions of professionalism.

title: 5, 2, 1, 0, 5: India batters collapse like a pack of cards; Hazelwood breathes fire!
content: India suffered a disastrous start in the second T20I against Australia at the MCG, with their top five batters dismissed for single-digit scores. A devastating spell from Josh Hazlewood, coupled with a run-out, left India reeling at 5, 2, 1, 0, and 5. The top order struggled significantly against the Australian bowling attack.

title: Justin Bieber opens up on Twitch about the pain of staying vulnerable in fame
content: Pop sensation Justin Bieber recently revealed the emotional toll of online interactions during a Twitch stream. He shared that despite numerous positive comments, a single negative remark can deeply affect him, often stemming from others' insecurities. Bieber emphasized that putting himself out there authentically is challenging, even for a global star, highlighting the human side of fame.

title: Rare earth unlocked: China allows shipment to India — which sectors will benefit
content: China has resumed shipments of heavy rare earth magnets to India, providing relief to key manufacturing sectors. However, these crucial supplies come with a strict condition: the cargo cannot be re-exported to the United States, amidst ongoing trade tensions between the two global powers.

title: ‘Didn't see them as enemies’: Why Indian team shook hands with Pak players
content: Indian junior hockey players defied political tensions by sharing high-fives with their Pakistani counterparts after a draw, showcasing true sportsmanship. This gesture contrasted with the cricket team's stance, highlighting a different approach to rivalry. Both players are now set to compete in the Hockey India League, aiming to further develop their skills.

title: 'Within hours, she stopped breathing': MP infant dies after taking ayurvedic cough syrup
content: A heartbreaking incident unfolds in Chhindwara as a five-month-old baby tragically passes away after reportedly ingesting a contaminated ayurvedic cough syrup. This grim event adds to the distressing tally of over 24 child fatalities linked to a dangerous cough syrup. In response, the local pharmacy has been shut down, and authorities are launching a thorough investigation.

title: The one-stop shop for Week 9: Storylines, picks and predictions for 13 games
content: Patrick Mahomes vs. Josh Allen? Can Denver and New England keep winning? Picks, predictions and stats for every Week 9 game.

title: Jaguars putting Hunter on IR, assessing injury
content: Jaguars wide receiver/cornerback Travis Hunter will be placed on injured reserve, with coach Liam Coen saying the team is still assessing the rookie's noncontact knee injury suffered in practice.

title: LSU interim AD given full authority for football hire
content: LSU interim athletic director Verge Ausberry will have full authority to hire the Tigers' next football coach, and he told reporters Friday that a search committee has already been formed to identify Brian Kelly's replacement.

title: ASU QB Leavitt to have season-ending surgery
content: Arizona State quarterback Sam Leavitt is expected to undergo season-ending surgery for a lingering foot injury suffered back in September, coach Kenny Dillingham said Friday.

title: WNBA, players agree to extend CBA for 30 days
content: The WNBA and WNBPA have agreed to a 30-day extension of the current collective bargaining agreement through Nov. 30, the players' association acknowledged Friday.

title: Jeered in Miami, McDaniel shares fans' frustrations
content: Plagued by "self-inflicted wounds," the Dolphins fell to 2-7 after a sloppy 28-6 home loss to the Ravens in which they were loudly booed by fans throughout.

title: Ohtani roles for potential G7 include opener, OF
content: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts will consider using Shohei Ohtani as an opener or even as an outfielder in a potential Game 7 against the Blue Jays.

title: Jackson prevails in HBCU coaching clash vs. Vick
content: DeSean Jackson's Delaware State team defeated Michael Vick's Norfolk State 27-20 in a historic matchup of HBCU coaches.

title: Wemby leads Spurs to franchise's first 5-0 start
content: San Antonio, behind star Victor Wembanyama, is off to its hottest start in its 50 seasons in the NBA.

title: Indiana and Ohio State are locks. Where do other CFP hopefuls stand in Week 10
content: Can Vandy keep rolling? Can Texas stay relevant? Will Georgia Tech avoid an upset? Week 10 will tell all.

title: How Vanderbilt has gone from SEC doormat to CFP contender
content: After years of being a punching bag, coach Clark Lea and the 7-1 Commodores are showing plenty of fight.

title: From backs to the wall to back-to-back? The dynasty Yankees give their advice to the Dodgers
content: What does it take to overcome the odds and repeat as champions? Buster Olney asked the last group of guys to do it.

title: Jackson returns in style as Ravens rout Dolphins
content: After starting 1-5, the Ravens have won two straight and Lamar Jackson has them in position for a possible run.

title: What we're hearing about the open Power 4 college football jobs and what comes next
content: Coaching changes are happening fast. With a month left in the season, here are six things to monitor.

title: The Mavs are turning the page from Doncic to Flagg with the help of veteran stars
content: Anthony Davis and Kyrie Irving are helping the No. 1 pick adjust to playoff expectations as a rookie.

title: The Great Player, Terrible Team All-Quarter-Century roster: Who got stuck on a losing team?
content: We picked out the best players at every position from the past 25 years who got trapped on awful rosters. Could Myles Garrett's 2025 season end up on the list?

title: The comprehensive guide to the women's hoops season, including preseason picks
content: Who's winning the 2026 national title (UConn? UCLA? South Carolina? LSU?) and other preseason picks, predictions.

title: Storylines to watch in all 31 men's basketball conferences
content: Will UConn or St. John's win the Big East? Here are questions that could shape every league in 2025-26.

title: Ranked: The top 50 players of the Premier League season﻿ so far
content: Now that we're nine games into the Premier League season, let's rank the best 50 players so far. Arsenal dominate the list -- but who else?

title: Tudor's Juve exit means McKennie must prove himself all over again
content: Weston McKennie has already proven himself to several Juventus managers, but with Igor Tudor getting fired, he now has another new boss to impress.

title: Latest NBA intel on the new star in L.A., Miami's new offense and more
content: How much money did Austin Reaves make himself this week? Why does Miami's offense look so familiar? Here's the latest intel.

title: NBA Cup: Let's project group favorites and the teams fighting for a wild-card spot
content: The third edition of the in-season tournament tips off on Friday. Let's take a look at who has the best chance to advance to Vegas in December.

title: WNBA, union agree to CBA extension -- what's next in negotiations?
content: The league and WNBPA agreed to a 30-day extension of the current CBA. How did we get here and what happens next?

title: 'I didn't even know he was a gambler': How the Blazers and NBA are grappling with Chauncey Billups' stunning downfall
content: The questions inside the Blazers' locker room and across the NBA are the same: How do we reconcile the man we thought we knew -- and a man the federal government believes is a criminal?

title: Timeline of past century's major pro sports gambling scandals
content: A history of the consequences when players, coaches and referees cross the line into the betting world.

title: Briscoe, Byron, Hamlin, Larson: Who will be crowned NASCAR champion on Sunday?
content: Just four drivers are left standing in NASCAR's 2025 playoffs, and come Sunday afternoon in Phoenix, one of them will be crowned Cup Series champion.

title: Paul-Davis? Norman-Haney? Ranking November's biggest fights
content: Nick Parkinson ranks the most notable boxing fights of the month and shares his thoughts on why you should watch.

title: NYC Marathon pacers guide thousands of runners to glory
content: NYC Marathon pacers are the human metronomes keeping runners on track in the race's most challenging moments.

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 9
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Drake Maye overtakes Patrick Mahomes as top QB
content: At Week 9, what should fantasy managers believe, or not believe, about Drake Maye, Oronde Gadsden II and more?

title: Risers and fallers: Trade for Trae Young, trade away Austin Reaves
content: Steve Alexander highlights fantasy basketball names trending upwards or downwards, with key takeaways for each.

title: Nebraska's black alternate uniforms headline best Week 10 threads in CFB
content: The Cornhuskers are going with an all-black look for their prime-time matchup with USC on Saturday night.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Two win streaks on the line at UFC Fight Night
content: One fighter's unbeaten streak will come to an end when David Onama and Steve Garcia clash at UFC Fight Night. MMA experts and a betting insider make their picks.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid edge Liverpool in Guéhi race
content: Real Madrid are leading the chase over Liverpool to sign Marc Guéhi from Crystal Palace in the summer. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Leopard movement on Tirumala footpath triggers panic among devotees
content: Devotees trekking along the Srivari Mettu route spot the big cat crossing the pathway at the 150th step

title: Stray dogs case: SC declines virtual appearance for Chief Secretaries, says States ‘sleeping over orders’
content: The top court had earlier taken strong exception to the fact that several States and Union Territories had still not filed reports complying with its August 22 directive mandating the sterilisation, deworming, and immunisation of stray dogs

title: NLC India ready to invest ₹10,000 crore in solar power projects in Telangana: Kishan Reddy
content: Telangana has also received approval for 450MW of decentralised solar power plants, along with sanction for 40,000 rooftop solar units, of which 20,000 units will be installed in first phase by the Central government, says the Union Minister

title: Kerala Cricket Association office-bearers can be tried under Prevention of Corruption Act, says HC
content: Allegations of corruption land deals entered into by the cricket association. A single Bench had earlier ruled that KCA office-bearers did not fall within the ambit of ‘public servant.’

title: Data trail aids Cy-Hunt make headway
content: Data from the special drive revealed that online trading scams (34.8 %) topped the list of cyber financial crimes in Kerala

title: Kozhikode Corporation Council demands Election Commission to withhold SIR
content: The motion was unanimously supported by the UDF and LDF councillors, while the six BJP councillors opposed it

title: Infant dies in Madhya Pradesh; family blames Ayurvedic cough syrup
content: Authorities seize medicines, send samples for testing; officials urge caution against over-the-counter remedies amid ongoing cough syrup controversy

title: Supreme Court to hear plea against Assam BJP’s ‘communal’ video on X
content: The video allegedly shows men and women in skullcaps and burqas in the backdrop of Assam's major landmarks with a message at the end to electors – ‘choose your vote carefully’; petitioners say the video openly targets, vilifies and demonises Muslims

title: CM to seek Central aid for cyclone loss in A.P.
content: Chandrababu Naidu tells officials to focus on protecting the submerged crops by draining out the stagnant water on a war-footing; advises people’s representatives to visit agricultural fields to assess the damage

title: Prohibitory orders in place around waste treatment plant
content: All public protests and assembling of four or more persons in the area will be banned for a week in the specified area following the Collector’s order, say police

title: TTD plans to upgrade Srivari Seva scheme, extend it to medical field
content: Executive Officer asks officials to take steps to roll out ‘Srivari Medical Seva’ that is aimed at at extending advanced medical services to the patients in key TTD-run hospitals

title: Resul Pookutty appointed Kerala Chalachitra Academy chairperson, Kukku Parameswaran vice-chairperson
content: Filmmaker Amal Neerad, screenwriter Syam Pushkaran and singer Sithara Krishnakumar included in the general council

title: Chief Minister Revanth Reddy assures ₹5 lakh ex gratia to the bereaved in floods and ₹15,000 initial assistance for damaged houses
content: The Chief Minister directs officials to  to conduct a comprehensive, on-ground assessment of the damage caused and enumerate crop losses at the earliest

title: Price Of Protest: Raipur Civic Body To Impose Tax On Demonstrations
content: The civic body in Chhattisgarh's Raipur passed a resolution imposing a tax of Rs 500 for holding protests or demonstrations in public open spaces across the capital.

title: No Top Court Relief For Woman Who Sent Bomb Threats To Frame Man She Loved
content: The Supreme Court on Friday refused to pass any "blanket order" staying registration of fresh First Information Reports (FIRs) against a Chennai woman techie who was arrested for allegedly sending emails of "bomb threats" using the dark web

title: Motion Detectors, Electroshock Weapons: Rohit Arya's Gear To Fight Mumbai Cops
content: The final act of filmmaker Rohit Arya's life unfolded in a cramped studio in Mumbai's Powai neighbourhood, wired with motion detectors, surveillance cameras, and locks that he thought turned the studio into a fortress.

title: Warfare Becoming Increasingly Non-Kinetic, Non-Contact: Army Chief
content: Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi said warfare is becoming increasingly "non-kinetic and non-contact" owing to multiple factors and therefore demands a response that requires military strength, and intellectual, technological and moral preparedness.

title: JD Vance's Remark On Hindu Wife Sparks Row. What She Once Said About Faith
content: US Vice President JD Vance recently said that he hoped his wife, Usha, a Hindu, would someday embrace Christianity like him.

title: A Crucible Of Choices: Navigating The Bihar Assembly Election
content: In the multicultural mosaic of Bihar's political landscape, this year's assembly election will stand as a defining moment, a crossroad where myriad factors converge, each vying for attention.

title: Pumps, Demure Makeup: Japan Municipality Slammed Over Dating Tips For Women
content: A Japanese municipality was forced to withdraw tips urging women to wear shoes that make them appear "delicate" or choose makeup that looks "demure" in order to secure a partner, after facing accusations of sexism.

title: Bail Pleas Of 2 Durgapur Gang Rape Accused Rejected, Fast Track Trial Ordered
content: A sub-divisional court on Friday rejected the bail pleas of two of the six accused in the case pertaining to the alleged gang rape of a second year medical college student in West Bengal's Durgapur.

title: PM Modi To Inaugurate India's 1st Digital Museum Of Tribal Freedom Fighters In Chhattisgarh Tomorrow
content: India's first digital museum dedicated to tribal freedom heroes has been established in Nava Raipur Atal Nagar in Chhattisgarh, showcasing the valour and sacrifices of tribal warriors who fought against British rule.

title: "Trying To Remove As Many As We Can": JD Vance On Illegal Migrants
content: JD Vance said it is totally "reasonable and acceptable" for American citizens to want to have neighbours they have something in common with.

title: Armed Robbers Break Into Gold Lab In Lyon In Another French Daytime Heist
content: Six people armed with military-grade weapons used explosives to break into a gold refining laboratory in Lyon on Thursday, slightly injuring five employees in France's latest high-profile daytime heist.

title: 26-Year-Old National-Level Kabaddi Player Shot Dead In Punjab
content: A national-level kabaddi player was shot dead after an argument with his friends in Punjab's Ludhiana district, the police said.

title: How Zubeen Garg's Final Film Sparked Assam's Single-Screen Theatres' Revival
content: When the first show of 'Roi Roi Binale' began at 4:25 am in Guwahati on Friday, queues stretched down the street.

title: "Met Me Several Times In Jail": Samajwadi Party Leader On Bond With Akhilesh Yadav
content: Senior Samajwadi Party leader and former Uttar Pradesh minister Azam Khan has dismissed speculation of a rift with SP chief Akhilesh Yadav, asserting that the two share an unbroken political and personal bond spanning nearly 45 years.

title: Video: UAE Man's Drive Home Takes Longer Than Uncle's Flight To Pakistan
content: The man shared a video showing himself stuck in bumper-to-bumper traffic after dropping his uncle at the airport.

title: Delhi Police Bust Cybercrime Syndicate Run By Indian Man Based In Dubai
content: The Delhi Police has busted a pan-India cyber fraud syndicate allegedly run by a Dubai-based Indian kingpin, arresting five people including a relationship manager of a bank for facilitating fraudulent financial transactions, officials said.

title: Israel Returns 30 More Palestinian Bodies To Gaza Under Ceasefire Deal
content: Israel has returned the bodies of 30 more Palestinians to Gaza as part of an ongoing exchange deal under a US-brokered ceasefire plan, a hospital told AFP on Friday.

title: 'American Dream For Americans': US Calls Out H-1B Visa 'Abuse' In New Video
content: A new video released by the Trump administration's Department of Labour on social media accused companies of abusing the H-1B visa program. It highlights that 72 per cent of visa holders are Indians, followed by Chinese at 12 per cent.

title: Pune Man Offers To Make Woman Pregnant After Reading Ad, Loses Rs 11 Lakh
content: Responding to an advertisement from a 'woman' seeking someone who could make her pregnant has led to a man from Pune being conned of Rs 11 lakh by cybercriminals.

title: Term Of Ladakh's 'Last Democratic Space' Ends With No Elections In The Offing
content: With no fresh elections to the Ladakh Autonomous Hill Development Council in sight, the end of its five-year term has brought down the curtains on the Union Territory's democratic space.

title: Telangana BIE’s digital initiatives draws praise from school boards
content: Learning about BIE’s digital monitoring and transparency measures, they toured the Command Control Room, which displays an advanced network connecting govt. junior colleges across the State

title: 73-year-old man sentenced to 13 years of imprisonment in twin POCSO cases
content: The case against the accused is that he had molested the girls who came to his shop to make purchases.

title: Woman killed, 54 injured as bus with pilgrims overturns in Madhya Pradesh
content: The incident took place around 9 a.m. in Baigaur village after the speeding bus overturned, skidded on the road and hit a divider

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu likely to visit Pulivendula in December
content: He is expected to formally inaugurate the water grid project meant to supply drinking water to the households of Pulivendula municipality

title: Single window system to overhaul TS-iPASS on the cards
content: Mooted as part of the District Business Reform action plan, it is expected to offer 44 services provided by various departments to industrial projects and across businesses on a single platform

title: Local body polls 2025: Unpredictability is the norm at Attingal municipality
content: The BJP has slowly made inroads in the civic body, coming second in the 2020 polls. The shift in voting pattern is a cause for concern for the LDF. The UDF too is looking at new ways to counter the saffron growth

title: Andhra Pradesh sees sharp fall in employment under MGNREGS
content: A report of LibTech India attributes it to decline in work availability, reduced incomes despite rise in notified wage rate, and introduction of new digital barriers for rural workers

title: Trinamool and BJP trade charges of threatening BLOs in West Bengal
content: This comes amid many BLOs in the State refusing to work citing “threats” and BLO associations asking for added security to carry out the SIR process

title: 15 years since formation, Kerala’s first tribal panchayat still struggling for amenities
content: Of the 26 tribal settlements in the panchayat, only four have been provided with electricity. Except to Societykudy, there is no proper road connectivity to any other settlement

title: Thunderstorms to make a comeback in November after a rainy October
content: The IMD forecasts that a fresh weather system will develop over the Bay of Bengal between November 5 and 7, potentially restoring typical thundershowers to the region.

title: Cyber police tighten net as ‘Operation Cy-Hunt’ targets more suspects
content: The move to step up the drive comes in the wake of encouraging results from the initial two-day phase, which uncovered a vast network of intermediaries operating within the State and their suspicious links with national and international counterparts

title: We are monitoring every Chinese vessel entering Indian Ocean, says Indian Navy Vice-Chief
content: In September this year, reports emerged of the Chinese tracking vessel Yuan Wang-5 operating in the Indian Ocean Region; Vice-Admiral Sanjay Vatsayan emphasised that the Navy remains fully alert and operationally prepared to meet any contingency

title: ‘Vigilance is crucial to ensuring equitable distribution of resources’
content: The Dharwad Superintendent of Police says that the Central Vigilance Commission has adopted a two-pronged approach in fighting corruption

title: It is a crucial November for the ruling Congress in Karnataka
content: The Congress top brass is expected to clear the uncertainty surrounding leadership change in November, soon after Bihar polls, as constant debate around the issue has dented the image of the governament significantly

title: Social security, welfare fund board pensioners to get ₹3,600 in November
content: ₹2,000 is towards pension recently hiked by ₹400 and ₹1,600 towards the final pending instalment. The distribution of the pensions will begin on November 20.

title: ‘Muhurthakaal’ puja for Vaikunta Ekadasi festival  performed at Srirangam temple
content: Pagal Pathu begins on December 20; Paramapadavasal to be thrown open to devotees on December 30, the day of Vaikunta Ekadasi; the celebrations conclude on January 9

title: Pedestrians feel sidelined as Bengaluru’s traffic signal system prioritise vehicles
content: With green lights lasting barely a few seconds and long waits at busy junctions, those on foot, especially the elderly and schoolchildren, feel left out of the city’s ‘smart traffic’ signals

title: Jharkhand govt establishes contact with 48 migrants workers stranded in Tunisia
content: 48 workers were employed for laying high transmission wires through a Delhi-based private firm which is working under a leading multinational company for the project in Tunisia.

title: RSS turned route march into a matter of prestige: Priyank Kharge
content: The Minister downplays speculation over a leadership change, saying such matters will be discussed in the party’s appropriate forum

title: Over 10,000 families get land titles across the State
content: Revenue Minister K. Rajan inaugurates a State-level Pattaya Mela in Thrissur. A total of 1,349 pattayams distributed across Thrissur district and 225 handed over personally by the Minister at the Town Hall.

title: ED, Tamil Nadu Police find themselves at loggerheads over registering FIRs
content: Advocate General P.S. Raman says Tamil Nadu police is not a post office to register FIRs on the basis of information shared by the Enforcement Directorate

title: Rapid response team gets new wildlife rescue vehicle for Wayanad
content: The rescue vehicle will enhance the department’s ability to respond to wildlife emergencies, say Forest dept. officials

title: Thiruvanaikovil residents want street to be named after C.V. Raman
content: The house where the Nobel Prize winner was born in 1888 is located close to Sri Jambukeshwarar Akhilandeswari Temple at Thiruvanaikovil in Tiruchi

title: 29 families to be rehabilitated from landslip-hit Koombanpara
content: NHAI should arrange for the insurance coverage for threat-posing homes, and the district administration will rehabilitate the 29 families with the support of the insurance claim: Minister

title: SC rejects Centre’s plea against reduction of IPS deputation in CAPFs
content: Bench says no case made out for review; ruling to progressively reduce IPS posts in paramilitary forces stands

title: Speed up Amaravati capital development works, Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu tells officials
content: Insisting on sticking to given timelines and according top priority to quality, the Chief Minister directs officials to complete the registration of returnable plots allotted to the farmers immediately

title: UDF terms LDF’s extreme poverty eradication claim an election-time hoax
content: The government’s whittling down of the acute poverty-stricken to 64,000 families isan insult to the public’s intelligence and an affront to the needy population, says Satheesan. Lakhs of families could lose welfare benefits, including substantial Central grants, he adds

title: Tezpur University teachers, students demand V-C’s ouster
content: Shambhu Nath Singh has allegedly been absent from the campus since September 22; the teachers’ body levelled allegations of corruption and sought a forensic audit into the procurement of books and e-resources

title: As another Kerala Piravi dawns, State’s long-awaited anthem still sleeps in files
content: Seven years after Chief Minister’s call for a State song, thousands of entries remain buried in the Sahitya Akademi even as controversy and silence linger

title: Industries warn of higher costs as BESCOM seeks ₹1.65 per unit surcharge
content: The proposal argues that the surcharge is necessary to recover fixed costs arising from stranded power capacity that Escoms continue to pay for, even when large consumers buy electricity from other sources

title: Karnataka accounts for more than 25% of cybercrimes in the country, says top police official
content: ‘Given the high level of digital awareness in the State and the corresponding increase in internet usage, a slew of digital frauds are being committed by miscreants’

title: ‘No Parking on ORR’ campaign kicks off with aim to curb accidents
content: Safety officials have identified such illegal parking, often involving heavy trucks and lorries without hazard lights or reflective warnings as a major cause of avoidable collisions

title: Cargo drones to play vital role in Air Force’s expansion plans in Lakshadweep, says Vice Chief of the Air Staff
content: IAF aims to develop, test and operationalise unmanned aerial systems capable of transporting payloads across long distances

title: Former Indian captain Azharuddin starts new innings as Telangana Minister
content: The former star batsman continued his tryst with the Congress party and was elevated as the working President of Telangana Pradesh Congress Committee (TPCC) around the same time when Revanth Reddy decided to switch his political loyalties to the Congress from Telugu Desam Party

title: Five get death penalty for murder of former Chittoor mayor, her husband
content: Describing the 2015 murders as 'one of the most brutal crimes in recent memory', the court also orders the five convicts to pay ₹70 lakh in compensation

title: School mergers in Madhya Pradesh’s Morena raises Right to Education concerns
content: Former Professor Arun C. Mehta and universal education campaigner point out that across India, the exercise of rationalising, grouping, or merging schools is often being carried out without proper school mapping, a key planning tool used to identify ideal locations for schools and ensure equitable access for all children.

title: Software engineer held with live bullet at RGIA
content: The bullet allegedly belongs to Vishal’s father, a retired army officer who holds a valid firearm licence

content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. title: When will Rodri fully return to form?
content: pep Guardiola reveals how far forward is from returning to action . the spaniard has missed the last four games since suffering a knee ligament injury . he has returned to full training with the squad in a 2-0 win over Bournemouth .

title: Back to Toronto! Here's what each team needs to do to win it
content: the 2025 world series is back in Canada for Game 6 on friday night . the Toronto Blue Jays are one win away from dethroning the Los Angeles Dodgers . if they finish the deal at Rogers Centre or will the Dodger team rebound? who is the world Series MVP through five games?

title: Despite the chaos, Bill Belichick and UNC seem to be improving. Is it enough?
content: bill Belichick delivered a sermon to the nonbelievers . he was not making changes to his staff after a 2-3 start and a blowout loss to Clemson . belichick says his team is better than what it was at the end of spring ball .

title: The unhittable pitch rocking this MLB postseason -- and the aces who will be throwing it in World Series Game 6
content: two of the foremost practitioners of the pitch that has defined October will duel at Rogers Centre . los Angeles Dodgers right-hander Yoshinobu Yamamoto is trying to save his team's season . the rise of the splitter over the past half a decade has transformed baseball even more than the cuttee .

title: NHL Power Rankings: 1-32 poll, Halloween identity for teams
content: this week's Power Rankings include a Halloween costume or identity for all 32 teams . a panel of ESPN hockey commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on the games through Wednesday . the previous edition, published Oct. 24, generates our list .

title: 🎃 2025's must-see athlete Halloween costumes
content: winger Nick Foligno dressed as Philadelphia Eagles head coach Nick Sirianni . Tampa Bay Buccaneers rookies showed up for their flight as Frozone from "The Incredibles" but he dressed up as a minion from "Despicable Me"

title: Second-half predictions: Who will win tight division races, MVP and the Super Bowl?
content: Damien Woody says Drake Maye is the best quarterback from the 2024 draft class . seven teams that missed the postseason in 2024 have a .500-or-better record this season . about 64% of games have been within one score (eight points) in the fourth quarter .
